FuncDef:
The cpu-defend-policy command applies an attack defense policy to an access point (AP).
The undo cpu-defend-policy command restores the default configuration.
By default, no attack defense policy is applied to an AP.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of the attack defense policy to be applied. The policy must have been configured.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 30.

Specifies the slot ID of a board to which the attack defense policy is to be applied.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To apply an attack defense policy to an AP's board, you can run the cpu-defend-policy command in the virtual access AP view on the master device. Alternatively, you can run the cpu-defend-policy command in the slot view on the AP.
To apply an attack defense policy to an AP in a non-1:1-backup scenario, run the cpu-defend-policy slot command.
To apply an attack defense policy to an AP in a 1:1 backup scenario, run the cpu-defend-policy redundant command.
Prerequisites
The attack defense policy specified by policy-number has been configured.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The slot ID specified in the cpu-defend-policy command can be that of a board that has not been properly installed or registered.
